attributes.action: Ensure that the Freedom of Information (Exemption) Bill does not become law.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Freedom of Information (Exemption) Bill - until those in power learn that there is nothing to be gained from working in secret, we will not be able to consider our society civilised.
Why does anything need to kept secret? What is there to hide? Many MP's have  made the point that the Data Protection Act provides the protection that Mr Maclean claims is needed.
This act makes us no better than those countries which we are fond of characterising as lesser societies, because they have not learned to share power. We should not call ourselves 'democratic' while we tolerate behaviour such as this.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
